questions.questionText: Vso is?
options: A. Stalling IAS in take-off configuration.
B. Stalling EAS in landing configuration.
C. Stalling TAS in take-off configuration.
D. Stalling CAS in landing configuration.

questions.questionText: What is MCRIT?
options: A. The highest free stream velocity at which a shock wave will form on the wings.
B. The minimum free stream velocity at which airflow first become sonic anywhere on an aircraft.
C. The minimum supersonic speed.
D. The speed at which wave drag is at a minimum.

questions.questionText: What effect does a supercritical wing have on MCRIT?
options: A. Increase.
B. Decrease.
C. Increase or decrease depending on thickness to chord ratio.
D. No effect.

questions.questionText: Which of the following produces best propeller efficiency?
options: A. Ensuring that the propeller wash has maximum velocity.
B. Ensuring that the propeller was 11 velocity is less than TAS.
C. Ensuring that the propeller affects the minimum practicable mass flow of air.
D. Ensuring that the velocity of the propeller wash is just higher than TAS.

questions.questionText: Causes of compressor stall and surge include? 1. Excessive throttle opening rates. 2. Excessive throttle closing rates. 3.Gas winds and manoeuvring. 4. High angles of attack. 5. Turbulence. 6. I deg of intakes. 7. Compressor wear or damage.
options: D. All of the above

questions.questionText: The nucleus of an atom is:
options: A. positively charged.
B. negatively charged.
C. statically charged.
D. of zero potential.

questions.questionText: An atom is electrically balanced when:
options: A. its protons and electrons balance each other.
B. the protons outnumber the electrons.
C. the electrons outnumber the protons.
D. the electric and static charges are balanced.

questions.questionText: The electrons of an atom are:
options: A. positively charged.
B. neutral.
C. negatively charged.
D. of zero potential.

questions.questionText: A NICAD battery shows a high temperature after engine start, this could be an indication of:
options: A. thermal runaway.
B. it is not connected to the battery bus-bar.
C. normal temperature during charging.
D. depends upon the outside air temperature.

questions.questionText: From the following list select the correct combination of statements. The primary task of the lubrication is to: 1. Reduce friction 2. Cool the engine 3. Clean the engine 4. Reduce component wear 5. Act as a hydraulic medium
options: A. 1 and 3
B. 2 and 5
C. 1 and 4
D. 1 and 5

questions.questionText: The main function of a supercharger is to:
options: A. Increase the thermal efficiency of the engine.
B. Increase the compression ratio of the engine.
C. Maintain sea level pressure in the engine to above rated altitude.
D. Increase the volumetric efficiency of the engine.

questions.questionText: On entering ground effect:
options: A. more power is required
B. less power is required
C. ground effect has no effect on power required
D. lift decreases

questions.questionText: When an aircraft enters ground effect:
options: A. the lift vector is inclined rearwards which increases the thrust required
B. the lift vector is inclined forwards which reduces the thrust required
C. the lift vector is unaffected, the cushion of air increases
D. the lift vector is inclined forward which increases the thrust required

questions.questionText: The effect of tropical rain on drag and stall speed would be to:
options: A. increase drag and increase stall speed
B. increase drag and decrease stall speed
C. decrease drag and increase stall speed
D. decrease drag and decrease stall speed

questions.questionText: Which statement is correct?
options: A. The stick force per 'g' increases when the CG is moved aft.
B. The stick force per 'g' must have both upper and lower limits in order to assure acceptable control characteristics
C. If the slope of the fe-n line becomes negative, generally speaking this is not a problem for control of an aeroplane.
D. The stick force per 'g' can only be corrected by means of electronic devices (stability augmentation) in the case of an unacceptable value.

questions.questionText: The regime of flight from the critical Mach number (Mcrit) to approximately M1.3 is called?
options: A. Transonic.
B. Hypersonic.
C. Subsonic.
D. Supersonic.

questions.questionText: In the event of a surge occurring the correct action to be taken is:
options: A. To close the throttle quickly.
B. To close the throttle slowly.
C. To open the throttle fully.
D. To close the LP fuel valve.

questions.questionText: The major disadvantage of a centrifugal compressor is that:
options: A. It cannot cope with a large mass flow of air.
B. It cannot be used for a turbo jet engine.
C. A larger turbine must be used.
D. It is more prone to damage than the axial flow compressor

questions.questionText: An advantage of a centrifugal compressor is that it is:
options: A. Dynamically balanced.
B. More robust and is easier to develop and manufacture.
C. Unaffected by turbulence.
D. Able to handle a larger mass of air than an axial flow compressor.

questions.questionText: Lubricating oil of jet engine
options: A. mineral oil with additives (compound)
B. mineral oil straight
C. Synthetic oil

questions.questionText: Electrolyte in batteries
options: A. Electrolytes are highly corrosive and if spilled in aircraft can cause extensive damage.

questions.questionText: 51) Materials which are conductor
options: A. Copper, Aluminium, silver

questions.questionText: The difference between anti icing and de-icing system is:
options: A. Anti icing system prevents the formation of ice while deicing system removes the ice after it is formed
B. De-icing system prevents the formation of ice while anti icing system removes the ice after it is formed
C. Anti icing is used in air while de-icing is used on ground

questions.questionText: What is most fav CG location for fuel economy?
options: A. CG located at forward CG limit
B. CG location be same as CP location
C. CG located at the aft CG limit

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a hydraulic check valve?
options: A. To direct the fluid in various directions
B. To restricts the fluid flow in one direction
C. To obtain fluid flow in one direction

questions.questionText: The power increase that occurs with initial increase in altitude when an engine has supercharger fitted is due to:
options: A. The increasing charge temperature
B. The reducing exhausts back pressure
C. The decreasing density of the atmosphere

questions.questionText: Materials which have free electrons are called:
options: A. Insulators
B. Resistance
C. Conductors

questions.questionText: An atom has gained an electron is called a:
options: A. Static 10N
B. Neutral 10N
C. Negative 10N

questions.questionText: The control which gives lateral control is:
options: A. Elevator
B. Rudder for control in yaw about normal axis
C. Ailerons for control in roll about longitudinal axis

questions.questionText: What is Vso ?
options: A. Vso stalling speed with flaps down and landing gear down.
B. Vso stalling speed with flaps up
C. Vso stalling speed with flaps fully down

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a hydraulic sequence valve?
options: A. To activate the shuttle valve
B. To sequence certain events
C. To activate fire shut off valve

questions.questionText: The on load/nominal voltage of each cell of a lead acid battery is -and on load voltage of one cell of Ni-Cad battery is:
options: A. 1.27 Volts /1.24 Volts
B. 2.0 Volts/1.27 Volts
C. 2.0 Volts/1.2 volts

questions.questionText: Current is :
options: A. A magnetic field produce around the conductor
B. Potential difference across the conductor
C. The number of electrons passing any point in the conductor in one second

questions.questionText: In a turbo fan engine, the fan speed is controlled by
options: A. A reduction gear
B. A waste gate
C. The turbine

questions.questionText: Major advantage of Semi Monocoque structure over a monocoque structure is:
options: A. Better strength to weight ratio
B. Cheaper to manufacture
C. It is lighter

questions.questionText: In modern aircraft L/D ratio is 10 and 20 to 1 which means
options: A. Lift is 20 times drag is 10 times
B. Lift is 10 times drag is 3 times
C. Lift is 10 to 20 times greater than drag

questions.questionText: Advantages of the Fly by wire (FBW)system over conventional flight control system are:
options: A. It is lighter and does not require the heavy control cables
B. Low weight leads to better fuel consumption
C. Both of the above

questions.questionText: Lead acid batteries are stored in a:
options: A. Semi charged state to prevent deterioration of the battery by sulphation
B. Discharged state and have a longer shelf life
C. Charged state

questions.questionText: A NiCad battery shows a high temperature after engine start, this could be an indication of:
options: A. thermal runaway
B. it is not connected to the battery bus bar
C. normal temperature during charging
D. depends upon the outside air temperature

questions.questionText: The phenomenon of flutter is described as:
options: A. Reversal of the ailerons caused by wing torsional flexibility
B. Rapid movement of the airframe caused by the vibration from the engines
C. Oscillatory motion of parts or parts of the aircraft relative to the remainder of the structure.

questions.questionText: The best extinguisher to use on a wheel or brake fire is:
options: A. CO2
B. Water
C. Dry powder

questions.questionText: When large aircraft are employed, a hand pump is usually used for:
options: A. Ground servicing purposes
B. Lowering the landing gear in an emergency
C. Pressuring the oleo struts in the air

questions.questionText: What is inertia?
options: A. Opposition which a body offers to change in motion.
B. A large mass has no inertia
C. Inertia refers to only stationary masses

questions.questionText: Upto which pressure altitude do most cabin pressure system operates to provide sufficient oxygen supply to the passenger?
The difference between anti icing and de-icing system is:
options: A. Anti icing system prevents the formation of ice while deicing system removes the ice after it is formed
B. De-icing system prevents the formation of ice while anti icing system removes the ice after it is formed
C. Anti icing is used in air while de-icing is used on ground

questions.questionText: Operational rough air speed VRA/MRA should consist of the following feature
options: A. Be maximum structural cruise speed is with ability to with gust loads
B. For utility category aircraft the positive load limit above is 4.4 and 1.76 the negative limit load factor
C. Should be high enough to avoid stalling and low enough to avoid damage to the structure

questions.questionText: Secondary cells can:
options: A. Not be recharged
B. Can be discharged and recharged many times over a long period of time
C. Can be recharged only once

questions.questionText: An Aircraft flying at Mach 1 at low altitude with an air temperature of 15 degree Celsius and an A/c flying at 30000 ft where the temperature is - 43degree Celsius, the effect on TAS will be:
options: A. Lower A/C will have a Lower TAS
B. Higher A/c will have a lower TAS
C. Lower A/c will have a higher TAS and Higher A/c will have a lower TAS

questions.questionText: 51) Materials which are conductor
options: A. Copper, Aluminium, silver

questions.questionText: The extreme right limitation a gust load diagram is the speed
options: A. Vd
B. Vc
C. Vb
D. Vs

questions.questionText: What's the limit load factor for a nominal transport category aircraft?
Thermal runway can take place in [___] when constant [___]
options: A. Alkaline batteries/current charging system is used
B. Ni/Cad batteries/ current system is used.
C. Alkaline batteries/ Voltage charging system

questions.questionText: Choose the correct statement:
options: A. Control system should be free of backlash
B. Backlash is free movement of cockpit control when the direction of movement is reverted.
C. All of the above

questions.questionText: Circuit breaker normally opens the circuit:
options: A. And has the capability of opening and closing the circuit
B. it may also be used as a circuit isolation switch
C. All of the above

questions.questionText: If an aircraft is statically unstable it:
options: A. Will only be dynamically stable at high speeds
B. Will never be dynamically stable
C. May or may not be dynamically stable, depending on the type of aircraft

questions.questionText: The difference between anti icing and de-icing system is:
options: A. Anti icing system prevents the formation of ice while deicing system removes the ice after it is formed
B. De-icing system prevents the formation of ice while anti icing system removes the ice after it is formed
C. Anti icing is used in air while de-icing is used on ground

questions.questionText: The beta range of a variable pitch propeller is between
options: A. feather and flight fine pitch stop
B. feather and ground fine pitch stop
C. flight fine pitch stop and reverse stop
D. ground fine pitch stop and reverse stop

questions.questionText: dihedral effect
options: A. Lateral stability about longitudinal axis

questions.questionText: How Adverse yaw is reduced?
options: A. Ans By Differential ailerons, Frise ailerons, Aileron-rudder coupling, Roll control spoilers.

questions.questionText: Ventral fin may be added as in additional contribution to
options: A. Directional stability
B. Lateral stability
C. Static lateral stability

questions.questionText: The altitude above which icing does not occur since the droplets are all frozen and will not adhere to the aircrafts surface is:
